intro: Lippia stachyoides, commonly known as green sage or Mexican sage, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine and as a seasoning in some cuisines. Lippia stachyoides is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
